body.head: Object Description
body.p: objectDesc contains all the information about the object as such. Within the form you should specify one of the available values. The object is further described in supportDesc.

div.head: Support
div.p: Into support a series of information about the material support are given.
In material with key enter the a value from the Writing Material taxonomy proposed from the schema. oXygen should prompt the values from the schema.

div.head: Extent
div.p: extent contains information about the global dimensions of the object. The value outer for type in dimensions indicates the external dimensions, including the board, the cover, and the spine. The value leaf for type in dimensions indicates the size of the leaf. The leaf from which the measurements have been taken can be added in a note linked with corresp to the dimensions element. In this way, measurements of several leaves can be added. Other values for type are possible.

extent.note: Data on leaves dimensions taken from .

div.p: Measurements in dimensions should always be given in millimiters, unless the source catalogues provides them otherwise.
You can also specify which leaves are blank, adding a locus immediately after the relative measure.

div.head: Collation
div.p: collation can be used to give textual information about how the leaves are arranged using a list of item elements.
Give a xml:id to each item in the list to be able to refer to this unit, using "q" and a consecutive number.
If only general information on the collation is provided and no quire structure is given, this information can be stated in a note inside collation:

div.p: Sometimes you might need to describe the position of a quire using locus elements. Please, do this in a note, as the locus element is here reserved for the quire extent.
Different numerations of quires are encoded as follows:

item.p: In item with n we encode the progressive number of quires, assigning "a" as value for initial guard leafs and "b" for final guard leafs. This information was given in Roman Numerals in DomLib, but needs to be in arabic numerals here.
The numeration given by the scribe is copied and annotated with a simple num with value element.
The number of leafs in the quire is given in dim
locus provides as usual the extremes.

div.p: Inside collation you can use signatures for quire marks and decoration of quiremarks.

div.head: Foliation
div.p: You might also use foliation with a list of items in it to describe different numbering systems used.

list.item: arabic numbers on the top right corner
ethiopic numbers on the left right corner
quire numbers on the bottom right

div.head: Condition
div.p: You can also add a condition element containing a fully marked up description of the condition of the manuscript. Do indicate a general value from the State of Preservation Taxonomy proposed from the schema for indexing purposes.
If no information on the condition of the manuscript is available, the element should be simply not added to the record.

div.head: Layout Description
div.p: layoutDesc contains the description of how the text is laid out on the page.
Each layout information is given in a layout element therein.
For example for measurement a series of specific purpose attributes and elements can be used:

If the layout measurement refer to a specific part of the manuscript a locus element can be used within layout to provide the range or a corresp with the ID of the msPart, msItem or quire in the collation, whichever might be relevant.

item.p: columns contains the number of columns on a page. One column should be encoded as layout columns='1', when no information is available, this element should not be added.
writtenLines contains the number of lines on a page.

div.p: The first dimensions contains the information about the text area. A rend can be used to list separated by spaces other visible characteristics.
The second dimension type=‘margin’ contains the measures of the margins.
